description:
I love pizza. I love trying new pizza places just so I can say "hey, I've tried their pizza and it's pretty damn good". There's not many pizzas I've had that aren't good pizzas. 

Escape From New York Pizza has pizza by the slice, which is great when you want to stop by for lunch and grab a slice and a drink and keep on with your day without a major commitment to a whole pie. To make it even better, there's options like the You Say Potato slice, or The Gourmet. In other words, you're not limited to cheese, pepperoni or sausage. Be extravagant and daring. Or not and get a cheese slice if that's the way you swing. 

Grab a table inside or sit outside and people-watch on Polk Street. Either way, enjoy your slice, it's delicious and filling.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Really surprised at how bad this place was!

I am not particularly picky when it comes to pizza, but I would never recommend this place.

I ordered a pizza for delivery and it took ~1.5 hours. I live within 10 minutes of the location. 

The pizza arrived in a soaking wet box and the cheese had slid off of the pizza itself. 
It was pizza crust with sauce and a pile of melted cheese next to it. So gross
author: Tess G.

description:
I like this place. They've been delivering to me for about eight years now. My favorite pie is Canadian bacon with mushrooms and roasted red peppers. Sometimes I order a meatball pie with fresh garlic and extra sauce, yum. Their salads are good too, generous portion of greens and fresh veggies. Even their delivery guys are nice! 

My problem is the bake on their pizzas is inconsistent. Sometimes we get a nicely baked pie. The crust is slightly crispy and soft at the same time. But sometimes we get one that's been in the oven for too long. Over the years I've just grinned and ate it, hey, it's delivery pizza. Tonight, however, it was a special kind of burn the cook left on it. 

I'm a big hungry guy, and I love my pizza, but tonight it was hard to choke down the char. Take a look at the pictures. It reminds me of that silent film where Charlie Chaplin eats a shoe. Not good. 

What urged me to write this review, after all these years is, I don't want to have to find another pizza place. I like this one. But I feel kinda disrespected tonight as a customer...that a cook would take a pie like this outta the oven, and decide, 'yeah it's good, wrap it up' and deliver it to me. 

So tonight I ate a burned medium pizza, a bit of salad, and the $40.36 that I paid for it. Escape From New York Pizza on Polk Street...really?
author: John F.

description: Came in for a slice after getting boba next door. The slices are big and decent variety. The pepperoni, sausage, peppers was good. Nothing really to complain about only the price. $6.25 for a slice is pricey but understandable. Order at the counter. Place is tiny with not much seating.
author: James H.

description: Love their pesto pizza, I wish I got more of kt. The cheese is so so but the Pepperoni was also quite food as was she slice has potatoes on it. Service was great, and as for our slices in a few minutes. I recommend getting it to go as she space is small and only have a few seats to sit at.
author: Tara K.

description: Very so so slice.   Not very expensive, but just kind of tasted like frozen pizza.   Ingredients didn't pop and the space is small.   Honestly, wouldn't go back.   Doesn't offer much to remember.  Edible.
author: Justin S.

description: Pizza here is pretty good, no doubt about that - thin crust with a crispy bite. We ordered a cheese slice and topped it with chili flakes and extra parmesan on the side. Slices are pretty large but I still think  think the prices are a tad high; however it does seem to be competitive for the area (about $4 for a cheese slice, a little higher for toppings) . We were the only ones here on a Thursday evening around 6pm and service was quick and friendly. Honestly, I quite enjoyed this pizza but I wouldn't go out of my way for it. I did notice that they had a potato pizza that seems to be quite popular on yelp so I might stop by to try one of these the next time I'm in the neighborhood or at one of their other locations!
author: Janice L.

description:
Escape from New York Pizza is located on Polk. 

I hopped in here and grabbed a Potato Pizza and while it was good it was a bit heavy for me. The taste was  not spectacular but different nevertheless and for that I appreciated it and definitely a little bit better than the average joint so that's why I hit it with a 3 star  rating.

The lady working the front was super friendly as well.
author: Rod M.

description:
I like this place; it's walking distance from my girl Traci's house and never disappoints late night.

Not the same as my NY favs like Joes but some great selections of slices for sure.
author: Danielle H.

description:
Potato pizza is soooo good! It has whole cloves of garlic on them. My bf likes their vegetarian one. Either way, you can't go wrong with any of the choices. They're all so good!

Great drunchie food since it's on Polk St. along all the bars
author: Winnie T.

description: If you're looking for good New York style pizza in San Francisco then look no further than Escape from New York Pizza. No corn meal. Big, thin floppy slices with just the right amount of sauce so you can crease and fold it, one handed into your face! You think you know a better joint for New York style pie? Fuhgeddaboudit.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Escape from New York was selling slices, so went for one.

eats: mushroom slice (4.36)
-big slice, crispy crust, yummy
-cheese, mushrooms, sauce almost invisible, tastewise. otherwise it was ok
not sure if couple ordered pizza when i told them "not bad" when asked.
*pizza not great either, like sauce to be more sloppy, pizza too dry here.
also, no carmelizing took place....

service above service by african american lady.
author: Victor G.

description: My office got a a bunch of different pizzas from this place. They were all, but the one that was unique and pretty good was the Figgy Pizza which had fig and bacon. It's unlike any pizza and worth having.
author: Ash M.

description:
Believe it or not, there are not a ton of spots as you're traveling down Polk Street between California Street and The Bay to grab a slice of pizza.  If I'm not mistaken, this is the only one I can think of.  There also aren't a ton of places to grab food late at night on this end of Polk Street.  Yet, there are quite a few places to drink when you're down this way.  Escape from New York fills a much needed role, and to its credit, it plays that role while offering a solid slice of pizza.

I can't speak for ordering a whole pizza from Escape from New York, but I've been really satisfied with the slices.  They offer a nice variety at any given time and each one has been good.  The crust thin enough to have a nice crispness and is substantial without being overly heavy.  The cheese/sauce mix is executed properly so that you don't have cheese floating on sauce.  The toppings are good, and the slices are warmed up in the oven to order, although several times I have been fortunate enough to get it right out of the oven.

Make a point of trying the Pesto, Potato and Garlic pizza.  Delicious.  Sometimes potato pizza can be a little iffy but this is done right.  The whole cloves of Roasted Garlic give this slice a great flavor.  I'm not sure if I could have it all the time, but when you're in the mood for these flavors, man is it good.  I would also give high marks to the Combo, with a good mix of meat and veggies.  I can always do the Mushroom slice.  And, as with any respectable spot (especially with New York in the name), the Cheese slice is good too.  I've always been happy.
author: Adam S.

description: If I do happen to eat pizza I always go out of my way to try and go to this spot. My friend introduced me years ago and I've been a loyal customer ever since
author: Janine F.

description:
Don't let this pizza escape your taste buds; the dough is fluffy and crispy at the same time-thin on the body and thicker on the crust. Plenty of options for vegetarian and meat eaters alike with fresh gourmet ingredients to appeal to foodie taste buds. Tried one with potato, pesto and garlic. This was a new way to do spuds for me, and I liked it. But then again, I haven't met a potato I didn't like. Very filling and surprisingly tasty combination. Just share a few bites with your friends or love so you aren't the only one with killer garlic breath ;) 
The artichoke heart, sun-dried tomato, spinach slice also tickled my fancy. 

All in all, these slices are good-sized, very filling, not too pricey, and easy to take to go or sit on the little cafe style tables to eat it hot. Make it escape to your mouth and you'll be full and happy.
author: Cyntia Q.

description: Pizza is fine - especially if you have had a few pops. But the prices are effing insane. $12 for two slices. Wtf? They have always been pricey but this is insanity - even in SF. Sorry NY, last time for me
author: Robert D.

description: Great taste. Thin crust. My favorite is the Hawaiian pizza. Is good option if you are hanging out around the area.
author: Mili D.

description: Bad customer service. Most likely out of slices before 2. So do not try to go there at the end of your night. And at least the staff shouldn't be saying sorry not sorry to their customers when they are out of food 15 mins before they close.
author: Kristi K.

description: I asked for my pizza to go the girl she dropped the pizza then put it in the oven, I came back the pizza was on a plate I a politely asked it to get it go then she put it on a plates and rolled her eyes at me something wrong with the girl working her look like she is on drugs or something
author: John V.

description: DO NOT GO HERE. Worst service I have ever experienced. After ordering a whole pizza the girl threw the receipt and the pen at my husband and when we called her out on her being rude she just rolled her eyes. Then they tried to give us a cheese pizza with raw toppings on a plate on the side...??? Who wants to eat RAW pepperoni??  The girl continued to be extremely rude when we asked if they could at least warm the toppings up. Even if you are desperate, do not go here!!! Awful, terrible, and rude!!
author: Kimia K.

description: Exceptional service and pizza. I wouldn't ask for anything more. Great job guys! We had the XL You Say Potato Pizza. It wasn't too greasy and the roasted garlic was fantastic.
author: Aaron W.

description: My teenaged boys frequently request this stop as we travel through SF.  It's a hole in the wall on Polk Street that sells pizza by the slice or whole pizzas.  There area few counter seats to eat your slice, but the majority of business is take out.  Their potato pizza, full of roasted garlic cloves on top, is so delicious, as is the pesto pizza.  My boys opt for pepperoni which they rave about.  Yummy chewy crust and generous slices make this a fun stop.  There are other locations in SF, this one just happens to be on our usual route.
author: Lisa B.

description:
Darn:(  The pizza sounded sooooo good on the menu, but in reality it wasn't.  First off I should say the good:  The delivery came on time and the delivery girl was super nice.   The bad:  Despite the pizza had tons of ingredients on it, it was not flavorful at all.  It honestly tasted like eating just crust...and the crust sadly wasn't great.  Boo!

I do not suggest the pizza "Miss Figgy".  It sounds good, but isn't :(
author: Kristy R.

description: Pizza was alright, but nothing special. It is big slices but one slice of cheese is $4, so it's a bit pricey for the quality. The guy also did not heat up 2 of our slices because he said the pizza had just come out of the oven a minute or two before but the slices were luke warm, not hot. Also they didn't have pepperoni even though their menu said they should.
author: Emma J.

description: Amazing customer service! We ordered an XL pizza to go but I had one child that wasn't too excited about the kind we picked. He wanted Canadian Bacon so the cashier made his night by giving him a 2 pieces! Made his night!
author: E W.

description:
To be fair, I haven't eaten at this place sober. And that might change my perception of it. But there's a few things that I think are key to a great late night place:

1. Friendly staff- I can't imagine working in a late night joint and having to put up with all of the drunken shenanigans but every time I'm in here (which is, ummm, not terribly often of course...) they've all got huge grins on their face and are super friendly and nice.

2. More than edible food- I think this pizza is pretty legit. They've always got a few options ready to go if you want it by the slice (chicken pesto, pepperoni, cheese seem to be pretty standard options), and if you want to wait for a full pizza it'll only take 15 minutes or so. Good crust, good price as well

3. Lots of napkins. Enough said.
author: Elliott W.

description:
My family and my original plan was to go to Teaspoon next door. We past this pizza shop and decided to stop by because we wanted a late night bite. As my cousin in law and I were in Teaspoon waiting for our drinks, my cousin and boyfriend came in with their pizzas. My boyfriend told me that an employee there was being extremely rude: rolling her eyes and not following standards. She dropped my cousin's pizza on the counter, looked up at them, and said "you guys didn't see that happen" and continue to serve that dropped pizza to my cousin. My cousin specifically asked for a TO GO BOX for his pizza. Instead of properly packaging it up like most pizza shops would, she stacked paper plate on top of the pizza. As a caring and protective cousin, it made me mad hearing that my family was being mistreated. I walked over to the pizza shop and asked "can I have a to go box?" She looked at me and ROLLED HER EYES ONCE AGAIN, and said "okay? With?" She saw that I was with my cousin and boyfriend. I said "I was with the two gentlemen that was just in here who got three pieces of pizza, who you were rude to. Can I have a to go box like what my cousin asked for in the first place?" She walked away and grabbed the box, came back, and nearly tossed it at me. She's clueless girl with short, curly, and dirty blonde hair!

You get treated the way you treat others.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I've come to this spot a few times over the course of 3 months and each time I come the pizza is always fresh, like super good fresh, like damn. The service and the food go hand in hand as the service is always very prompt and polite! 5 stars! Looking forward to my next visit.
author: Sami M.

description: Ryan is awesome. Great customer service! He deserves a raise! Muchas gracias to Ryan!
author: Gaby M.

description: Literally the most amazing night pizza I've ever had! I'm in heaven. I live in the south bay and will come back to sf for the best pizza ever
author: Jenn F.

description:
This little Pizza shop on Polk is the definition of A-OK. There's nothing particularly special about the pizza, especially for almost 5 bucks a slice, but it gets the job done as a quick grab-and-go place if you're in need of a speedy lunch option.

The staff who work here are all friendly, and although I haven't really had any conversation with them, they always greet me. The big plus side of this place is that the pizza slices are huge, and that means 1 slice will do the trick in filling you up. They have decent selections, and I've personally tried the mushroom and pepperoni and thought it was yummy.

Final verdict: the pizza here is good. It'll do job when you're hungry and it's quick to make- they'll throw it in the oven for a minute or two and you're set to go. Don't expect anything spectacular, but do expect a filling slice of pizza!
author: Alex B.

description:
I had the "You Say Potato" pizza and had a great experience. I thought this pizza was very original and tasty. It comes with sliced/roasted potatoes and roasted garlic cloves on top of a white sauce (pesto). Its very, very good, but also very rich in flavor. I found myself pulling some of the garlic cloves off because there was just too much.

Many years ago, I too escaped from New York.  I think this contributes to my love of dirt cheap, truly east coast style (it's all about the crust and sauce), by the slice pizzerias and Escape from New York Pizzeria definitely fills that bill.
author: Tina S.

description:
Not great New York style. 

Customer service sucks! Girl behind counter looks like she is on drugs or something. Why work if you don't want to do the job.

For 5 bucks including tax it's a vary bad deal.
author: Sam B.

description: Came to SF for the weekend and every city we visit, we must find a new pizza place to try ! We found this one on Yelp and my goodness, were we happy with what we found ! (: This place is EXCELLENT. It's been a long time since I've had a pizza with this style that has tasted THIS g o o d. This place hit the spot PERFECTLY. I was a little skeptical about the wings because I like my wings "saucey" and these ones looked plain and dry BUT although they lacked sauce, they were still quite spicy and not plain at all and that made me VERY happy ! (: We will probably be stopping by this place one more time before we head back home later today !
author: Nyomi M.

description: Awesome greasy New York style pizza. Everyone who works there are proper pizza folks. Quick, friendly, and up to no good. For other reviews saying it doesn't match up to NYC pizza and whatnot... go to New York and have your beloved pizza then.
author: Richard J.

description:
I may have found the fountain of youth again. 

In my younger days, I would go find any place that is open after the bar is closed for a quick bite to absorb the alcohol. I was a hardcore party-animal at that time. As a result, I got fat and gained weight for doing this. 

Fast forward 20 plus years later, I may no longer consume a high-dose of alcohol again. Nor my liver can withstand the assorted beer and/or liquor. I still rely on a greasy slice of pizza to alleviate my inebriation. 

For $4.50, my slice of pizza has pepperoni, sausage, onion, and peppers. Quite pricey for a slice of pizza, but I was drunk and not willing to drive all over the city to save money on eats. 

So I could care less. As long as this pizza place is open after the bar is closed, I am one happy drunk-bastard!
author: Matt G.

description: Can't rate the food - didn't get that far. Walked in last night, no other customers in there, two employees standing facing the door - neither greeted us. One employee looked down immediately and started making weird noises and the other just stared at us. We turned around and walked out to eat somewhere (anywhere) else.
author: J S.

description:
#For Vegetarian: Cheese pizza is good one. As, I am not a mushroom fan so that the only option left. But, cheese pizza was yummy. With each bite I felt I am eating in New York.
# Place : Space is less, but you can seat and enjoy the downtown view. Walgreens is in front of it, watch people shopping from there :D
#Staff : very friendly, they will clear your doubt regarding vegetation/ vegan options.
#Open late night!
author: Gemini J.

description: The pizza was real good. I tiny little shop on polk, to satisfy your mid night hunger, or lunch needs. Will definitely come back here when I am back on Polk. But there are tons of pizza shops just like this one all over the city. The pizza was good, but doesn't have me screaming from the mountain tops
author: Ross S.

description:
I like this place. The pizza is always good. The service is great. Everyone is so nice. I like how they play old Led Zeppelin kind of music. It brings a good vibe to this place.

I always get The Gourmet. It's the artichoke and spinach slice. It's my favorite. I've been here a few times, and the pizza is consistent. I'm never disappointed. I Love their pizza.
author: Edie G.

description:
Do not go here!! They are thieves and liars at this site!  I was there on Saturday, August 6, 2016. I ordered a couple of slices of pizza and a drink. When I was paying for it I set my Costa Del Mar sunglasses on the counter. I realized it 5 minutes later after I took my pizza to my car a block away. When I asked for them back, the girl behind the counter says to me with a cold dead voice, they aren't here.

 Bad on me for leaving them. Worse on them for being thieves and liars!!!

I have been there a few times since I discovered it. I will NEVER go back again. Unless something changes I won't go to any of their sites either.
author: Amanda G.

description:
I'm gonna keep this short and sweet.

GARLIC. PESTO. POTATO. PIZZA.

One of the best, quick slices I've had in my life. (aside from golden boy, of course)

Straight out of the oven, large enough to share (although I didn't) and PACKED with flavor. it never stood a chance.

For $4.99 it should be a no brainer if you're looking for a quick bite on the go.

Tip: nicks tacos gets busy on Tuesdays. Pop over to escape from NY, indulge and get back into nicks with your stamp. And forget about meeting your new boo for the night.... The garlic is intense and will scare off any potential love interest.
author: Ryan L.

description: Their pizza is outstanding. I'm not a great pesto fan but their pesto slices are magical. And the simple margarita pizza is also so delicious. One of the fewer places in Russian Hill that's open until 11pm so it's my rescue place when I get home late from work
author: Harshad M.

description:
One of the BEST pizza places I've tried! The pesto pizza was amazing and if I could I would eat a whole pizza to myself!! 

Love that it's by the Slice, easy convenient and affordable!
author: Adriana B.

description:
Very small place on Polk street. 
They don't have a bathroom but the pizza was great! Fresh and hot!
Guy at the counter was very friendly.
No parking and prices range from $4 and $5 per slice
author: Enrique R.

description: Always a good drunk place to go too! They have a wide variety of pizzas from pesto pepperoni to other unique flavors.
author: Kunal T.

description:
Late night, freshly made pizza on a Friday night after Polk? Nothing is better. Although it took us a bit of time to trek here, we made it and were not disappointed. Despite most of the veggie pizza being sold out and it almost being 1:30 am, the man working there made the 5 of us a fresh mushroom pizza. It was warm, delicious and hit the spot. 

Howeverrr under other circumstances, this pizza would probably be 3 stars :) But the service / fresh pizza gives it a 4 in my books. Will return!
author: Anu P.

description:
We frequently order pizza from here for our office and each time the pizza has been solid. It's not blow me out of the water pizza but it is a great place to get something for a team!

We've had the margherita pizza which as no sauce--just cheese, basil, and tomatoes. This one may be my favorite! Not too heavy. I would have appreciated if the flavor of the basil came through a little bit more but hey! I'm not complaining.

We've also had the garlic potato which was great but the pesto sauce left me feeling like the pizza itself was a little dry. There isn't quite enough sauce to balance out the heaviness of the potato on the dough. So much starch and so many carbs!

The plain pesto is a little boring--not enough pesto/sauce! But I do feel that way in general about their pizzas. The pizzas are all a little light on the sauce and I like my pizzas a little saucier.

The great escape--I think this is the one with the pepperoni, onions, and mushrooms was great! The ingredients balance each other out nicely with the onions providing just enough kick. My one comment here would be that the mushrooms were cooked a leeeeetle too long and were a little dry.

The salads are also great and we always order a pan!

Overall, the service is always great. I can't say anything about the in restaurant dining experience as I've only had it delivered BUT here's my two cents on service: Friendly people who make sure that the pizzas look great and didn't get squished or lopsided in the delivery process. And prompt as well. We've never had a problem with the delivery or order process here!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Came here because my boyfriend is a fan of the movie and he wanted to eat here because of the name. We were deeply disappointed...it's really expensive for a slice of pizza to start. I got a cheese slice and I think mine was close to $4. We got three slices and my boyfriend paid $15! $15!!!! My slice had little to no sauce, was not tasty, and was kinda burnt with big air bubbles everywhere. 

I feel bad because this place was all my boyfriend could talk about...I honestly I don't know why we even bothered getting pizza here when we can get great pizza whenever since we're from Northern NJ and live close to NYC. 

Lesson learned for next time!
author: Linda R.

description:
This is one of my favorite pizza places in the City. The pizzas are good and I have been buying from them for a long while.

Now the people that work here are usually cool and they are sort of related to the people that work at ZA which I also frequent, but occasionally you get some one who is less cool. Or just doesn't make any sense.

This past week or so I came in and ordered 3 slices of pizza. They gave me the smallest slices possible. And on top of that, the person helping me dropped the biggest slice and then replaced it with a small slice. The guy was like, "oh sorry, but I will give you one for free." 

Hm...ok, thanks, but that doesn't make it alright. I can actually pay for my pizzas. I can really use a bigger slice instead 3 smallest slices as I am feeding 3 hungry people. Myself included. Grrr... Oh and when I ask them whether there were other pizzas coming out soon, they are like, "No" and then right when I was about to leave, they came out with pepperoni! WTF. I asked them to change one of the slices out for the pepperoni and of course the guy there gave me the stink eye. But you know what, I have had enough of it. And I should have ask that he change out the smaller slices too but I didn't.

Thus the 2 stars. It's for the UNCOOL person or people working there...
author: Missy X.

description:
This place makes bomb pizza. Their regular pizzas like the pepperoni and pesto are good. Although, one thing they do not tell you is that they make vegan pizza. You have to buy a full pie but it's delicious, with thin crust and all kinds of fresh vegetables like sun-dried tomatoes, artichoke hearts, and lettuce. They are quite pricey but if you have people splitting it, it's totally worth it. 

All in all, After a long night at the bar this place takes care of all your alcohol-induced hanger pangs without a doubt.
author: Dominic B.

description: Escape from New York Pizza is seriously over rated. The business should offer their patrons a choice of thin crust. Also their prices are ridiculously high for what you get. The "spicy" salami is a scam. First of all, it is NOT spicy. It's just salami. Gallo, Columbus or other brands are just as good or better. "Zoe's spicy salami" is not spicy or special in any way; therefore it should not be equal to two (2) toppings. Escape from New York is also quite stingy with the cheese and sauce. I have no clue why Escape from New York has been so successful other than the name, "Escape from New York Pizza" being a very strategic marketing tactic, because it's nothing like New York pizza. That would be Victor's on Polk Street or Amicis. Also their "sausage" is totally lame. Nobody slices sausage like that ok. Please.
author: Michelle V.

description: Grabbing a slice of potato pizza after hitting up the Polk St bars has turned into a ritual for me. Staff are super chill but get you your slice in no time. Never gotten any pushback for using a credit card, which is always appreciated.
author: Ross R.

description:
Worst pizza delivery ever.
Waited for TWO HOURS for a pizza. Can't believe we had to wait for TWO HOURS for a pizza.
Can you wast your time? Go for it
Don't even give any star
author: Yoko I.

description: This is a great place for a quick hunger kill.  One slice is five bucks but totally worth it.  One piece is enough for almost two people.   I got a chance to try the Pesto Potato.  OMG it is amazingly flavorful.  Always friendly faces behind the counter and quick too.  You are in and out in no time at all.  I hear the veggie pizza is a taste bud overload!  Will try it soon!
author: Jerrie J.

description: This pizza is good for a quick stop when you're really hungry. It is also a really good option when you've had too much to drink and need something to soak up some of the alcohol so you don't feel like death in the morning.. The staff is super friendly and not judgmental when you order enough for two and you're just one person! Definitely recommend this place after 10 pm..
author: Jazlyn H.

description:
Ordered a large veggie combo, lose the olives, add sausage.   Guy said then it ain't a veggie combo anymore.  Yup he had me there.

We were hanging at the Greens Sports Bar and needed a snack - this place conveniently a block and a half down the street.  Pizza toppings were generous, plenty of everything.  Good sauce flavor and plenty of cheese.  Crust OK but not top-tier by any stretch.  Gave us plates and such as well along with those annoying little packets of red pepper and  cheese, which is good as I am big on the pepper flake.  

Anyway not a destination quality pizza joint but good with the game and a beer.  Guys at the counter are cool.
author: Jerry P.

description: I love their you say potato pizza, which you can always get by the slice.  I typically eat it hot and greasy in their little standing room area where you can snarf down the whole slice quickly.
author: Matthew F.

description: My go-to slice spot in sf. Big slices. Friendly staff. Delicious pies. Favorites are cheese, pesto, and potato/garlic.
author: Jason B.

description:
Came here because my friend was raving about their potato pesto pizza.

Good stuff!  Cheap and greasy, just like pizza from little places like this should be.  

The potato pesto is very heavy though, but I suppose that was to be expected.  I generally don't like it when pizzas replace marinara with a different sauce, but this one actually worked very well.
author: Soo H.

description: Had no customers inside and kicked elderly man out when it was cold and rainy. He wasn't homeless. He was just waiting for his wife. I could understand if they were busy but it was completely dead inside. They were laughing about it after.
author: Erick M.

description: came here after nicks tacos/rouge.  open late.  located right next to a sports bar that allows you to bring food. so no brainer.  pizza and booze.  perfect combo.  thin slice of course since new york.  they pretty fast at making pizzas so you dont have to wait.  they probably figure at late night its all just drunk people that dont wanna wait.  the toppings were pretty good. flavorful from what i remember.  gotta say i wasnt completley sober eating this though.  id go back for late night snacks here. decent price.  happy camper.
author: Matthew G.

description: We tried the you say potato, vegetable, and mushroom pizza slices. $14 for 3 pieces of huge slices, each of them enough for a meal? Um, yes, please!
author: Mingmei N.

description: Consistently the best pizza I've had. I've tried ordering from other pizza places in the city but I always come back to Escape from New York. I've tried their pizza on their Haight street location as well and it's amazing. You can't go wrong with any of their options. My personal favorites are glorious chicken, buffalo ranch, and the great escape. I also am an avid fan of the ones where you choose your own toppings, like artichokes and olives or pepperoni and pineapple. The ingredients here are always fresh, the tomato sauce is tangy and robust, the cheese has a great umami flavor, and the crust here is the perfect blend of crispy and soft. Their online ordering system needs some work so I definitely recommend calling them. They also store your credit card number and address, which is truly a life-saver! The best pizza in San Francisco, hands-down!
author: Hana K.

description: Tabbing a quick bite before heading home. Escape from NY Pizza never disappoints! Stays open late, and hands down one of my favorite go-to stops for pizza! Highly recommended!
author: Jerry K.

description:
Used to be a good pizza place, now it's just sloppy pizza with subpar ingredients. Really sad. I grew up  in SF, going to Escape from NY so always support and promote their locations. Not this one. 

I usually find that at by the slice places like  E from NY it's always better when you order an actual pie not an individual slice. But I still expect a slice of pizza to be passable, especially when it costs up to $10 for 2 slices. The cheese is always cold and chewy, toppings (like their sausage) not very appealing and the desire of the staff to keep fresh pizza stocked non existent. I understand that I shouldn't expect fresh of the freshest slices, but come on guys, your slices are always old and lazily looked after.

Also, put a smile on your face, Haha. I already feel guilty that I'm stuffing myself with pizza, don't make me feel awkward or as if I'm annoying you as well. You do work at the place I'm trying to purchase something, so not sure why you look so annoyed when I walk in and say hi. Do I have a scary face?
author: zach B.

description: When you are on Polk and Broadway and want to listen to transgressive music while ordering a slice of pepperoni and jalapeno, then this is the place for you. Everyone else: they probably have a slice for you too
author: Casey L.

description:
Drove across town to this place & arrived 10 minutes before their closing time. 

 Was told they're not making anymore pizza because their oven would take too long while he was outside smoking cigarettes #Laziness. Lost a regular customer
author: Billy S.

description:
I absolutely adore this place. without a doubt my favorite spot to grab lunch while working. the atmosphere is divey unlike the rest of the nose up - ever gentrifying San Francisco (emphasis on Polk street).

Brandon is always a pleasure to talk to and 100% of the time makes my experience well worth the walk. 

The rest of the staff resembles a small family and never fails to say hello to me by name as soon as I step into the establishment.

pizza is always awesome - huge slices without skimping on anything. 

this place kills it. 100
author: Dominic G.

description: Really loved it!!! Nothing to complain about it... Pizza is really good and also the people who works there. Went there 2 times, during my visit to SF. :-)
author: Mariana B.

description:
I just walked in an hour ago to the Polk location and ordered a $40 pizza to go...asked the guy working the front and phone if I could get the pizza done w crisp crust...he said yes, come back in 20 minutes...

     I returned and he didn't recognize me..."Oh!  Here's your pizza" after I told him I was there 20 minutes before...

     All good...but what was not good, was when I asked if they could put it back in for a few minutes...it was underdone, floppy, and had a waterlogged texture on top.

     The pizza guy cook came from the back and said "no.". "It would only further cook the top of the pizza..."

     He then said he felt it was perfect and gave the pizza back to me.

     True story...I was completely courteous...and such a bad pizza that it ruined my Sunday pizza night with my girl.

     Avoid at all costs...this is a terrible-quality pie, at a place that should stick to serving down and dirty slices only.
author: D N.

description:
AWESOME pizza place. Their slices are freakin' big and they always have a nice selection of four to five types of pies. Their employees are chill, and the decor  has some heart. Spot the two "Escape From New York" action figures on the wall. 
The space is incredibly limited during the day time and around dinner time. Best suited for pick-up and take-out. Great place to go late at night. They always have some great jams playing. Eat here TONITE
author: Chris Y.

description: Pizza was pretty damn good or I was just hungry. Was walking by after catching the Warriors game from a bar nearby and smelled the fresh smell of pizza. Tried a pepperoni slice and it was pretty good no complaints.
author: Koby G.

description:
Thin crust, late night pizza at $4.25 a slice. 

This is the perfect place to check out after a night of dancing and drinking. New York style thin crust pizza is by far my favorite. I tried a slice of  pepperoni mushroom and it came out hot and fast. It was delicious, as pizza at this time and intoxication state always is. I was a bit surprised at their pricing though, but I'm sure the late night crowd is not one to complain. 

If I am around Polk street, I wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Augusto T.

description:
Sober - 2 stars, Intoxicated 3.5 stars.

Being from the East Coast, its not easy to find good pizza in SF. This place is all about convenience. The pizza is Meh, and paying $4+ for a meh slice is not my idea of a good purchase. When this place is one of the only spots open in the neighborhood after 10pm, the game changes a bit, but with so many other options during the day for better food in the area, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless its late night.
author: Steven G.

description: Skipped lunch. Needed an emergency slice. V pleased with the size of the slice, and the piping hot delicious taste. I'd go back! You should too!
author: Matt M.

description: Damn that was a good slice of pizza.  I just grabbed two slices of mushroom because they were ready, but good lord they hit the spot. Perfect in every way.
author: Aric W.

description: Delish! Friendly staff! Little pricy..but worth it. Pesto garlic potato...yes please!
author: Lauren R.

description: Thanks yelpers, I needed a pizza delivered and wanted it to be GOOD so I ordered the pesto/potato pizza and every loved it! The delivery arrived ahead of schedule :-) , the pizza was hot and all is well-thanks Escape from NY! The pizza was delicious!
author: Thalia F.

description: They stuff the To Go slices in brown bags. Makes for a rough, greasy walk. Can we get some actual pizza boxes?
author: Paul M.

description: This just in. The medium artichoke and olive pizza has not changed since last weekend. Will continue to update reviewers on possible changes with weekly updates.
author: Allison D.

description:
Hot. Fresh. Slice of Pizza.

Only been here twice but will def be back for more!!  TD4W !!!!!!!
author: Jeff M.

description: pizza ready to reheat and go. I had the veggie  and my bf had the hawaiian slice. the slice was huge and the crust was kind of dough and hard. But the  sauce of the pizza was delish would return again for the quick bite and other choices of slices to go.
author: Linda B.

description: Great taste. Fast service. They take debit/credit cards. Will return and enjoy. It was late when I got there so I only was able to eat a slice of cheese pizza but it was wonderful.
author: Tatiana G.

description: Went to get a slice of pizza that was expensive and burnt. Employees there rude!!! Encountered the bald guy working there he seemed to be aggressive and on drugs
author: Nathan D.

description:
Apparently this location of Escape From New York Pizza is a joint collaboration with ZA Gourmet Pizza which I love. However, the benefits of this said joint venture are very subtle to the say the least but for a late night slice, it more than suffices. 

Nothing too special about the pies - I wished the wonderfully crispy cornmeal crust from ZA would carry over to the slices here. However service is quick and efficient and they've always had a decent selection of pies to pick from when I've stopped by. Forget about eating in though. This is a grab-and-go location with minimal seating. 

This location of Escape From New York Pizza is good for late night post-boozing slices, but definitely better pizza can be had during regular hours.
author: Jon L.

description:
EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. I. HAVE. ATE. THIS. PIZZA. THE. BOTTOM. IS.......

BURNT! BURNT! BURNT!

Who the hell is making these pizzas?

And can we talk about the guy who answered the phone for a minute?

The rudest piece of work I have had to deal with concerning ordering a pizza in a while. DAMN!

My service is what pays you BRO!

I wanted to give him attitude back but I was afraid he might spit in the pizza or something lol but.... my, my, my

People, one more time, PEOPLE!

F THIS PLACE!

not worth it for burnt pizza and rude brats you have to deal with
author: Natalie B.

description:
It does the job as far as drunk food goes. But I can get the same quality pizza for $1 in New York City. I ordered a slice of the pesto garlic potato. I normally love all three ingredients, but something was missing. Finally, it dawned on me: meat! It needs chicken or bacon to off set the garlic and carbs. Plus, the crust is flavorless and sits in your mouth like a hunk of cardboard.

On the plus side, the slice is huge. But I can still get the same for $1 in NYC...
author: J J.

description:
These guys used to be good.  I've been ordering from here practically every week for the last 3 years.  In the last 6 months or so they've gone done hill.  Celery instead of onions on the pizza, missing toppings.

You can do better in San Francisco.  Maybe try one of their other locations.
author: Luke D.

description:
Great pizza, great music, and a wonderful staff.

I'm visiting from San Diego and my fiance' and I stumbled upon this place after we had made reservations at a restaurant and we're highly disappointed. I was a little down because our Valentine's night didn't go as planned but as soon as we walked in here my spirits were immediately lighted. The staff are amazing greet you with a smile as soon as you walk in suggest drinks they like in case you don't want the fountain drinks. Pizza was delicious and responsible price. The overall vibe was amazing and completely turned our night around.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
Don't waste your money here. Ordered food...waited for 45minute for pizza. No pizza. Called and the manager said that the order was nowhere on system. Looked at my statement online.... Charge for $42.03. No customer service......
Update: Few days later and a whole lot calmer.
Never got my pizza that night. Ended up calling a different one of this stored in the area. The manager there, Lexi i believe, was much more helpful. She took my info and told me that she world call me back and let me know what happened. She ended up getting a hold of one of the owners. He logged into the system and solved problem. Moral of the story is, not all escape from new York pizzas are bad. I just ran into a bad manager. I'm give them a couple of more starts for that. 1 star to 3.
author: Michael T.

description:
My favorite pizza in the city.  I'm just wondering why they only put out one container of red pepper, parm cheese and seasoning.  We always have to hunt for it at the outside tables or asks the other customers if we can use it.  It would be nice if they had a second set that stays at the counter.

The potato, garlic and pesto pizza is awesome!
author: Liz Y.

description: Escape from New York is solid pizza. They don't skimp on the toppings. My favorite is the potato garlic which is yummy. Not the healthiest of meals but you have to indulge sometimes!
author: Sunil R.

description: Was looking for a place to get food and found this, cute little place with delicious pizza, I would give a 5 stars, but the place could use a little dusting; but cannot complain; pizza was really good.
author: Da Kine B.

description:
Stopped in for a slice of "You Say Potato" which features sliced and Roasted Potatoes and whole roasted Garlic Cloves over Pesto Sauce...

the line went quick and we lucked out on seating on Polk Street so that sarted off the expertience right. The Potato and Garlic combination was interesting but I felt like it was missing something.... hence the 3-stars. About half way through, I dediced the missing ingredient was artichoke hearts. 

Perhaps next time I visit San Fran, they'll have a "You Say Potato, I Say Artichoke" option.
author: Nicole M.

description:
If you love "meh pizza", this is your joint!

They have a good idea but ultimately their pizza is super expensive and really salty.  If you want thin pizza, just hit up Za on hyde (owned by the same folks but 10x better for some reason). 

Their pizza isn't bad per se, it's just REALLY expensive and not good ($4 cheese slice what?  I just had a $3.25 pepperoni slice at Golden Boy earlier the same night!)  I think the only reason they're in business is they're the only game in town on Polk street.  

Anyone want to go in on a pizza joint on Polk?
author: Matt P.

description:
YESSSS!

I always wanted to try the Haight location..lord knows how many times I've been to Haight and I've NEVER EVER gone.  I finally got to try it Friday night before going to Rouge (honestly, we had more fun eating pizza than we did at Rouge) because we were STARVING.  

We were here at about 11pm-ish and it was pretty crowded.  Lots of tourist, lots of drunkards..and some others satisfying some herbal munchies.

Pepperoni never tasted so good.  Neither has pesto.  I really wanted to try mushroom but I guess they were all out.  The crust was thin and had a nice crisp crunch to it!  I usually like thicker crust like Seniore's but I really enjoyed the thin crust here.  I hate it when you take a bite of pepperoni and it pulls off a huge chunk of cheese :(  oh well...still tasted good.

Fairly decent sized slices @ about $3.33ish a piece.
author: Steph D.

description:
Escape From New York Pizza is our go-to delivery option at home. The fact that this location is so close to where we live (just a few blocks away) means we get our pizza that much faster. I like the fact that the crust is more substantial than what you'd get in New York. (It is "*Escape* From New York Pizza" after all.) The ingredients seem quality, and overall it's definitely better than average pizza for San Francisco (though you do pay for it).

I like the ease of ordering online -- you never have to talk to a person (!) which, though it may seem anti-social, actually means you have a strong chance of getting exactly what you want (and you can order any weird combos of half and double toppings you can imagine). The storefront is great for stopping by for a slice as well, but most of the time we just bite the bullet and order in.

Almost three years after writing this review, it's all still true - kudos to Escape from New York for consistency!
author: Jason G.

description:
Unreliable and dishonest ... Regular crappy pizza delivery that you have to wait for eternity. Then they mess up your order ... call them, complain ... "ohh so sorry ... next time half off, ok?" ... Order next time, call them ... "can I get my promised half-off?" ... "What? We have no note of it ... sorry ...." 
Will never order from them again ... they obviously don't care if the customer orders again or not ...
author: A B.

description:
**DISCLAIMER***

I have never eaten this pizza when I wasn't ragingly drunk, but I always end up wandering here when I am, so I believe this speaks to the consistently satisfying quality of the pizza. 

**The Pizza**

I generally opt for anything that looks like it's just been pulled out of the oven, and after a few hours wandering Polk Street on Friday night, many people end up waiting in line here, so they turn out new ones pretty quickly whenever I show up. 

This is definitely pizza that's exponentially better hot, as the crust comes out crispy and the toppings piping and gooey. I found that when left to sit and fall to a temperature that's not scalding the roof of my mouth, this pizza just isn't as tasty.

**Pluses**

-  I appreciate that they take credit cards here, otherwise I'd never manage to eat at this place, being too uncoordinated to take money out of an ATM by the time I get here, and since I never carry cash anyway 

- Thank god there's at least 1 place on Polk that's open relatively late. A gal's not always in the mood to risk IBS by getting a bacon wrapped hot dog on the corner 

- Toppings - I love that they have out shakers of not only pepper and parmesan, but herbs and garlic powder. I usually shake enough on there to destroy a Robert Pattinson army

- Fast service - I hate waiting in line more than anything, but they're usually quick about it and friendly, even late at night when I'm slurring and pointing at some undeterminable slice going, "I waan dawon wid AW DA GARLICS BLEEEEEAGH."
author: Selina K.

description:
I swear to god this happened and I guess it's a San Francisco thing but I just went there to try and grab a slice or two and all the slices were old (whatevs, I can deal) and/or like a farmer's market vomited on them (not as dealable).

I opt for the only plain slice, which looks old as hell, and ask for pepperoni on it.  Response: "Oh no.  We don't do that here".

Left kind of in a daze and stumbled home (sober).  Obviously, my thoughts on reality are wrong and I am living in Christopher Nolan move.  obviously. I just left a place and they told me they can't put pepperoni on a plain slice of pizza.

Or maybe I am just really drunk and or high and asked them to sautee a baby seal spleen and make me a calzone with it?

Maybe.

But I feel 100% sure that "Oh no.  We don't do that here." came out of someone's mouth.

And now, I have to move.  goddamit.
author: Jason H.

description: USELESS!!!!! What's the point of a pizza place that closes before the bars do? Don't waste a trip they are closed by 2AM!!!
author: D K.

description:
Best pizza I've ever had - MUST TRY
My friend and I came here when we were hungry and too lazy to go to a sit down, and we found this gem. That was a year ago and I visited SF again just for this pizza. I recommend the artichoke pizza (vegetarian gourmet) - the pizza that brought me back.
author: Sreeja S.

description:
Someone needs to make a law that states you cannot call a pizza "NY style pizza" unless it really is.  There are so many pizza places that use that as mostly a selling point.  Sadly, this was another.

The pizza was actually decent   but it certainly was not NY style (too much crust).  The service was also friendly.  If you don't mind a little more dough in your crust you will probably enjoy this pizza.
author: Jessica D.

description: 1. Really delicious pizza, both pesto/ cheese and pepperoni were worth getting again. 2. The pizza was affordable. You wouldn't feel bad spending 4 dollars at 11 at night even if you didn't remember it the next morning. 3. Snake plisken figurines set my heart ablaze. Frankly, I live 2 hours away and will probably never go back, but it was delicious!!!!
author: Sam H.

description:
So, my wife is currently pregnant and she is only supposed to be eating cheese that is pasteurized. Without the EFNY website saying so, I had to make sure that the feta and mozzarella cheese was indeed, pasteurized. 

Realizing that this was possibly a busy time being 6:45pm, I needed to ask this question. A girl by the name of Jarrell (sp?) took my question and asked me to hold so she could ask her manager. I held (for a brief time) and she came back to say yes, the feta is pasteurized. Well, we decided to order, so I had to call back...unfortunately, I noticed that the Gourmet pizza comes with Mozzarella as well. As much as I hated to have to bother Jarrell (sp?), I had to ask this question. She was courteous, professional and very sweet.  But, most of... patient. 

As far as the food, either you like EFNY or you don't. As far as a thin style (NY style) it's one of my top 3 in the city. Always tastes fresh and is good sauce as well. 

I have been a manager in the food industry and worked in customer service for quite a while.  Jarrell's attention to detail and courteous phone etiquette just tops it off for me.  I have been a customer at EFNY for a while and I will be for years to come. I truly appreciate their customer service and truly appreciate the good food as well.

 I think people should know about this and as far as EFNY goes... you have an asset with someone as professional as Jarrell thank you so much.

-SL
author: Christos L.

description:
I love this place.
I love that when I call for delivery they have all my info stored including my credit card...so I don't have to repeat my name, address, cc number and all that all over again.  It is sooo simple and quick.  I love the people that work there...they are always so nice and if you don't have a coupon they will apply one anyway.  Even the delivery people are super friendly!  

So the pizza....we think it's great!  We usually do half and half and have a really weird order but they always get it right.  I love the pesto sauce with mushrooms and garlic and my bf loves regular sauce with their awesome bacon and red onion.  Seriously both sides are so good!  Nice thin crust....yummy, yummy, yummy. Also, their salads are amazing!  Get the Caesar or Liberty...both are HUGE and loaded up.  Cheap too!  

Quick delivery even on rainy days when other places seem to take forever, great customer service, delicious pizza.
author: KJ G.

description: Pesto pizza is really good. I'm from Italy so believe me, I know what I'm talking about.
author: Samuele M.

description: The cashier with the long hair put up in a pony tail is quite possibly the most entitled rude employee I've encountered and should not be working up front. I walk in there listening to music and already hangry from my work out, and he said "How are you doing?" I asked for a slice of supreme pizza, and he stopped me and said "I asked, 'HOW ARE YOU DOING?'" Damn, since when do I need to answer a question before I am served food? He didn't even smile. Who would say hi to that? Never coming here again for their ripped off $5 slices of pizza. I'll take my business elsewhere!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I called and ordered a pizza/salad and was told 40-45 min for delivery (spoke with April). 50 min later I called to ask if our order was close I was told that the driver had left with the wrong order and they had not been able to contact him - When I asked any idea of how much longer April literally freaked out! Said she didn't know I was using a stop watch to wait for my pizza (in this case dinner for our family) and then hung up. I called back April answered, I asked for a manager and she said she was the manager. Then started yelling (??) saying "there are other orders before yours", "hopefully the driver is not dead", "it's not my fault that your pizza didn't deliver on time"... and so on. Then, she hung up again. I called back once again (spoke with Shawn) and asked him to please not hang up and said if the pizza wasn't going to deliver soon we just needed to cancel and I would order from someone else. He said "who knows, but if you keep calling back we can't call the driver". 

What!?! This is all they do, right? Just make pizza and deliver it. Terrible.

FOLLOW UP - our poor delivery guy just showed up. Unfortunately, 1.5 hrs after our original order we placed and received dinner from another pizza shop. Interesting, I provided April/Shawn with both our land line and my cell for an update on the status of our order .... Nothing from either.
author: Jody G.

description:
OK pizza.  Only a few options that were fresh out of the oven.
-no hot wings
-no hot sauce except for tapatia
-mostly takeout business

On the plus side they do have 2 outdoor tables.
author: M S.

description:
I've been here in two separate and very different occasions: sloppy late-night drunk at 2AM after Polk st clubbing and sitting on my living room couch on a lazy Sunday. Clearly, I target this place at the most vulnerable of times.

I thoroughly enjoy the slices here. They're greasy and cheesy and satisfying. They always taste fresh and piping hot, which is really the only way I'm ever stuffing a pizza in my mouth. They make the crust exactly the way I like it. However it is important to note that is is NOT a typical NY crust, which is crispy and thin on the edges. The crust here is quite bready and soft.

Here are my top favorites, in ranked order of course:

1) You Say Potato: Pesto Sauce, Mozzarella, Potatoes (POTATOES!!) and Roasted Garlic Cloves.

2) The Great Escape: Red Sauce, Mozzarella, Pepperoni, Mushrooms and Onions.

3) The Gournet: Red Sauce, Mozzarella, Feta, Sundried Tomatoes, Artichokes and Spinach.

-----

Distinguishing factor: Might just be the best late-night/delivery pizza place on Polk. The pizza variations, and their corresponding names, are downright genius.
author: Nick A.

description: They have the best gluten free crust. I ask for it to be extra well done so it tastes more like an italian thin crust pizza. I appreciate that Escape from New York Pizza allows for modifications and prioritizes to ensure customer satisfaction.
author: Regina F.

description:
Along the strip that is Polk Street in San Francisco lies Escape From New York Pizza. I live in Nob Hill and frequently walk down to this joint for a slice when I am 1) lazy and 2) have a craving for pizza. The saddest part of this experience is when I take it to go; only to come home with the cheese and toppings stuck to the side of one of two paper plates they use as an impersonation of a to-go box.

It's not the kind of pizza you can pick up and eat- it's limp. They definitely need to either use thicker crust or leave it in the oven longer. Sub par at most, but it tastes pretty okay. I enjoy the pesto and the mushroom.
author: Kristin F.

description: GOOD DRUNKEN NIGHT PIZZA.  'Nuff said.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I don't know if the pizza escaped from NY, or was kicked out of NY.   It's pizza late at night, and that's about it.  Tastes like something you'd make at home I guess, but the crust and cheese was not NY style.  Speaking of cheese, how did they not have cheese slices?  That never happens in NY.   Just change the name so I don't get my hopes up.

Oh btw , the closest to NY style here is Arinells' in the Mission.
author: A A.

description:
Sometimes I stop by on my walk home and grab a slice for dinner.  Huge slices, and surprisingly good too!  

My favorites are potato+garlic+pesto and spinach+artichoke+feta.  

If you live in the neighborhood, keep an eye out for money saving coupons in the mail.
author: Joanne G.

description: Great place to grab a slice after the club, found this place on a random walk outside after having a few drinks... pizza is delicious- i can say it still holds up as the best combination slice ive had in forever, and the movie reference to "Escape from New York" is just as epic as the pies.
author: Cito F.

description: I happened to be walking by a couple weeks ago and decided this place was worth a shot. They had some interesting looking pies, and I figured I'd try something different. They had a pesto pizza with garlic and mushrooms that was decent, and a veggie pizza that turned out to be pretty bad. The flavors just didn't go together and it actually tasted kind of sour. With two slices costing me about $10, i felt pretty ripped off. Looks like I'm going to have to find another pizza place in San Francisco
author: Amaresh S.

description: Generally good pizza, but their management has clearly sold their soul. They subscribe to the belief that quantity heavily outweighs quality. The guy at the counter tonight literally said to me that they didn't have the license to add veggies to a cheese slice - what??! No agency regulates that! Absurd and dishonest. Won't be returning there.
author: Jessie J.

description:
Love this pizza! It's in the neighborhood I always stay in and is a great place to come on weekends right after the bar closes. 
The employees can be a bit unfriendly, but the pizza is good! I had never had potato pizza until I came here!
author: Roxanne R.

description: Every time I call the person on the phone is always so friendly and helpful. I really appreciate that! Pizza is great too! What more could you ask for? 5 stars!!!
author: Cat C.

description:
When you are drunk and the clock strikes two a.m. a slice of pizza is a gift from heaven. 

Escape From New York is my go to place for late night drunk munchies. It's quick, open late, and easy to eat even while you are stumbling back home. The pizza has an excellent crispy thin crust and is surprisingly not greasy at all. The toppings aren't the best, but overall still a damn good slice. 

Thanks Escape From New York for enabling my nights of drunken shenanigans, thanks to you I never have to go to bed drunk and hungry.
author: Tom L.

description: I've been ordering pizza from here for years.  Very consistent quality.  Classic, American style pizza.  I've ordered by the slice a few times, and the girls at the register are always sweet.
author: Mitori H.

description:
We ordered delivery from Escape from New York Pizza and it came relatively quickly, which is a huge deal (as you know) when ordering food. The pizza was delicious (as pizza goes), but not outstanding or different in any way. 

We had The Margherita and the New York Pesto Chicken. Both pizzas were tasty and the crust was very buttery (in a good way!). My two critiques are that the garlic was barely present in the Margherita and the chicken on the New York Pesto Chicken pizza had a hint of plastic taste. It's pretty standard (and good) pizza, the service is quick and professional and I would recommend for delivery.
author: Kate B.

description:
I'm kind of a pizza freak, and I must say, their Potato garlic pesto pizza is one of the best quick slices you can grab in the city....that is pretty much the main reason I ever go in here...

Food - Overall, the slices are very average. Considering, as I mentioned above, I'm obsessed with pizza, I am pickier than most when it comes to my pizza selection. With that said, their other slices (outside of the potato garlic pesto) are average, at best. That one slice though, is out of this world..I literally dream of it. The way that garlic and potato melt in your mouth with the pesto taste complimenting it, is, well, indescribable. If all their selection was this good, I would give them 5 stars without  a doubt. Their pep, cheese, and Hawaiian Slices are too greasy, aren't flavorful enough, and don't do anything that excite me.

Service - Extremely inconsistent. Sometimes they're great, sometimes they're so extremely grumpy. Literally, every time I go here I have an experience that is at one extreme or the other. Then again, you can't expect a bunch people in their early to mid 20's being stoked about having to deal with a bunch of drunk idiots on a Friday or Saturday night.

Overall - GET THE Potato garlic pesto slice!!!!!!!! ....... I'd give this place 3.5 stars if yelp had the option,...I'd give it 5 stars if it was based on my orgasmic one slice, and if I didn't take the occasional mean-mugs I'd get from the staff when I said I'd like to wait for my pesto slice into play...but I have to rate the place as a whole...
author: Farbod D.

description: Great place for a late night grab of a slice of New York Pizza. Staff is very friendly and if you are not careful, you can gorge on 4 slices before you know it.  Very fresh and hot.
author: Sonny G.

description: WTF never ever ever order from this place! We ordered and they made us wait an hour . it came out, and they refused to sell it to us. Is this real? Two hours later no pizza. I used to love this place. Order from This is only a place if you want to be completely ripped off. Someone call Better Business Bureau
author: Cristina M.

description: Going from 4 stars to 1 star may be drastic, but this place just doesn't cut it. $35 for a pizza with two extra things which didn't come on it. The phone guy rushed my order rudely and when I called back he was poised to have them argue with me about it. The point is - if a person can't even tell the extras are there even if they were (and they were not) then isn't something wrong here? There is nothing distinctively good about this pizza or the phone guy. Don't pay for what you aren't going to get.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
For me, it's about the quality of the food.  Escape has the most delicious pies, being a sister resto to Za, up the hill.  The crust is the perfect thinness and their generous cheese distribution is perfect.  I ALWAYS get pepperoni anywhere I go and this one is easily the best in all of SF.  It's on par with actual NY pizza.  Yes, I know you NYers won't agree, but I've been to NY several times and I still feel this way.

I'll have to admit, it can get really douchey and annoying after last call, but this place never lets me down as far as food quality.  I've had it after a few drinks and I've had it in the middle of the day and it tastes just as delicious.  In fact, I think I'll order a pie for lunch now!
author: Joel G.

description:
You are at the bar. You look at your phone, it's 1:45AM. Suddenly, the bartender shouts, "LAST CALL!". All you think is, Why?! Lame, jerks, ugh...There is always one person of the group who shouts.."ESCAPE!" 

or you know its almost last call, you've got about 5 guys bombarding you trying to get your number because if they leave without one, they feel like their night is an epic failure. They end up having 0 numbers and where do they end up? Escape. That's right, Escape. The only woman they will take home that night is a Hawaiian one, but a pizza that is. 

We all know its not the best pizza..but you know you've all been here..don't lie..

As you are in the line, you really want one, but you know its bad. Then you see people pass right by you with a you say potato, pepperoni, mushroom and cheese melting pizzas. Yumm you think, fine just one. I will seriously work extra hard at the gym this week. Before you know it, you've made not 1, not 2, but 5 Facebook friends in that line. Then you see them in your news feed or you find their numbers in your phone, and have possibly no idea who they are. Unless you save it as "Bob Escape", then you are like Ohh. I remember..

I have to say, I've met very cool people in this line. No, not the ones coming from Rouge, the ones in appropriate attire sitting on the stools drunk people watching. It's amazing how many stories come from Escape. 

Escape: The best late night grub in the city.
author: Stephanie M.

description: $4.15 for a thin slice of pepperoni pizza.  It was a bit greasy and salty.  Meh.
author: Animal K.

description:
You Say Potato, I say Heaven!

The slices are under warming lights, so there is no wait time for the food to be heated up. It's not quite as warm as Haight street's pizza, but still great and has outdoor tables!
author: Em L.

description:
If you're looking for a quick bite or a an ecclectic assortment of toppings for your pizza pie, check out this pizzeria.  There are only a few seats and most people grab a huge slice of the pre-made U Say Potato pie with pesto and garlic.  Although the pizza crust is thin and crunchy, it doesn't have the elasticity in the dough that I miss from real NY pizza.  Nonetheless, I keep coming back for more whenever I'm lazy to cook and starving in Russian Hill.

Service is friendly and fast.  You'll get your slice or pie in about 10 minutes or less especially if you call it in.  Parking is tough on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description: Over priced! $30 w tip&tax for a medium supreme. .. I've had better frozen pizza. Big disappointment. Expected better
author: Pamela Z.

description:
Their slices are as good as their pies. I'll repeat, their slices are as good as their pies!! I came here this past weekend and their pizza is amazing. The staff is very nice and didn't rush me even though they were very busy and don't have much space.

The one downside is that I wouldn't plan on coming here to eat-in and definitely don't being a dinner date here. This place is VERY small.
author: Andrew M.

description: My coworker won tickets at a radio station and they served us lunch from this place. I do have to say that the pizza was really yummy. I like that the crust is not too thin and not too thick- just right. My favorite is the hawaiian and the combo.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Good pizza. We ordered ahead and they lied about how long it would take. Waited an extra fifteen minutes but it was worth it. Place seemed disorganized.
author: Byron M.

description:
Pizzas here definitely taste like the ones from NY.  The store opens late night and it is great for those doing the bar scene nearby.  The staff is very nice and patient.

The pizza crust is crunchy and the pizza comes out piping hot after they reheat it.

There are some drawbacks to this place: 1) Above average pricing 2) Lack of seating 3) Lack of topings on pizzas 4) Lack of choices

This place really caters to the no fuzz / I want food crowd.  Unless you are in the area, I won't come all the way here for pizza.
author: Wendy K.

description: $4.95 for a slice of mediocre-at-best pizza is just ridiculous.  I don't care what rents are in this city!  When you're charging that amount for something that costs approximately $.23 to make, something is seriously wrong.  If it were mind-blowingly delicious, that'd be one thing.  But for a barely servicable slice of Sysco ingredients, you are being shamelessly ripped off.  Boo!
author: Kyle F.

description:
I was pissed drunk & wanted late night grease so I won't be useless the next morning.  Nothing tops drunken pizza... how can a slice of cheap pizza go wrong?

It went wrong.
author: Dave K.

description:
I'm not good at many things.  To demonstrate, I will happily draw your portrait, order menu items in foreign languages, or sing karaoke. 

But, I am good at problem solving. 

For example, this past Sunday I was preparing for the Yelp Holiday Hangover Party by applying the five coats of makeup needed to look like I'm not wearing any makeup, when I looked down at my left ring finger and noticed my engagement ring was loose.  

Oh, the horror!!  What's the fun of getting engaged if you can't show off to your single friends? (Besides changing facebook relationship status, of course) So you can just imagine the trepidation I felt at going to a party with a baggy engagement ring.  

Which made Escape From New York Pizza my only hope.  We wandered down to Polk Street and walked up to the oh-so familiar counter (behind which were, predicatably, 1 semi-motivated cashier and what seemed to be the entire cast of That 70's Show hanging out and looking bored).  But, I wasn't there to judge, I was there on a mission for a miracle.  I ordered a not-too-sad-looking piece of mushroom pizza and coke, inhaled both, and then all we could do was stare at my skinny finger and wait.

(Do you know where I'm going with this?  You do, don't you?)

Pizza + Soda = Puffy Finger = Perfectly Positioned Engagement Ring!

See??  I am a crackerjack problem-solver.  Sure, it's in the same vein as reality tv brides who gain weight to fit in their wedding dresses (you don't alter Vera to fit you, you alter yourself to fit Vera), but it saved the day on Sunday and I need something to be good at, so I'll take it.

Helping me through this difficult time earns EFNY Pizza an additional star, though I wish they encouraged better customer service and had fresher slices ready to go.
author: Janney B.

description:
I think I found a new favorite pizza!  Pesto, red potatoes, and garlic pizza!  So nom nom nom!!!!  
I have always been a fan of crunchy thin crust pizza.  I HATE IT when my pizza is soggy :(  Pizza is NEVER meant to be eaten with a folk or knife.  I want to be able to pick it up and not fall apart.  I love their unique style and favor.  One of the best in SF.

The staff is very patient and friendly.  (I couldn't decide what to order)

The only one draw back is the lack of seating space.  But we manage to tuck ourselves in the corner and enjoyed our yummy pizza!

The price is decent.  $3 gets your a slice of pizza!
author: Norm K.

description: Always great customer service!! Every time I come to SF, I have to order from here. Their pesto chicken and applewood BBQ chicken are the BEST. When I go into the store, it is always clean and the managers/owners have always been more than accommodating when it comes to my children (I have 7 so its hard to find someone who can tolerate the activity).  Highly recommend to everyone!!
author: Katherine W.

description:
This might be a biased review considering we went here about 2AM after heavy drinking.  The pizza was really good.  Really crispy crust and good flavor overall.

Definitely recommend coming here for a late night snack.
author: Vitaliy L.

description:
I love the U Say Potato pizza. There's always tons of potatoes, tons of roasted garlic, and lots of oily pesto.

That said, I generally hate everyone that works here. 

One time, I ordered an entire U Say Potato pie to go. They fucking gave me a BIG MEAT combo. what the fuck. I didn't even find out till I was at my destination.

Today, some scumbag delivery driver totally kicked the shit out of my ankle and continued on with his day without as much as a glance, as though my ankle was just like his pathetic existence: meaningless and hindering.

I should open a pizza place next door and call it "Escape from Escape from New York pizza" and hire nothing but people that aren't total scumdumpsters (there may be too many of the letter "s" in that word) to do the EXACT same pizzas they do.
author: Ben T.

description: Nice friendly staff. Good size slices. Pizza is pizza and escape from New York doesn't disappoint. Solid option with no waiting. Go for it when in the hurry and need of a great tasting slice.
author: Try E.

description:
The shameful thing is that a pretty good pizza is made completely undesirable because of the atrocious customer service.  The employees (specifically the woman running the register) appear to be living in some sort of warped world where discourteousness, indifference, and dereliction of duty are a good way to run a business.

Came in around 7:15pm on Saturday 10/25.  Ordered two XL pies.  The ovens were not full, and most customers were ordering pizza by the slice.  After 40 minutes, and watching other groups order a full pizza and receive it before we had gotten ours, we went up to ask.  Not sure if the girl working the counter was having a rough night, but she had clearly forgotten to put our order in.  She responded rudely as well when we asked. Over an hour and 10 minutes later, we finally had food in hand.

If you are into skydiving without a parachute, riding your motorcycle at 100mph through the snow, and ordering whole pies at Escape from New York, just be sure you understand the risks associated with the choices you make.
author: Ken P.

description: I like it when I need a quick bite. The slices are pretty good and I usually get the super combo. A whole medium pizza will set you back about $24, but it is easily at least two meals if not three. Sometimes it seems like the staff isn't very organized as they've mixed up my order a couple times.. but whatever. If I need a pizza fix that is close to home, this is the spot.
author: Ryan L.

description:
As soon as I walked in I saw a tray of sorry looking pizza. Dried out cheese, overly floured bread, hardly any sauce...just like new york pizza come to think of it. 

The only reason I didnt leave is because I wanted pizza at the moment and the price wasnt awful. But the pizza is nothing to sing about and a waste of time if you are really craving pizza.

Escape!
author: Ash S.

description:
Oh my GOD.

BEST PIZZA PLACE EVER.

There was this old pizza parlor by my home as a kid, and it closed down yeaaaaars ago and I was never able to find a pizza place that was quite as good as it.

THIS FINALLY TOPPED IT.

The pizza is delicious, fresh, and just awesome. The crust is what makes it so great. Huge slices, great ingredients, worth the price. 

They don't have that best selection, and it's super cramped inside, but I didn't mind one bit. We just walked past it on a visit to SF and decided to step in after our friend who lived in the area suggested it. It's also a huuuuge plus that it's open late. We came in for one slice each and ended up splitting two more! 

I was craving this place last night, but it's just too bad that I live in Orange County in SoCal so I'm going to have to wait until school starts again to go get some!
author: Zuleima B.

description: We love the potato pizza its the best and this place plays great  music and friendly staff
author: Jason W.

description:
I'm an Escape From New York addict.  I really am.  I cannot pass any of their locations without stopping in for a slice of pesto pizza.  Mmm...

This location isn't my favorite, but it is the one I am around most frequently.  The pizza is just as good as the other locations, but I seriously hate the lack of seating here!!!  NO tables inside, just a shelf wrapping around with some tall bar stools.  I bring the 2 year old that I nanny for with me sometimes, and I literally have nowhere I can seat him, which is annoying.  The last time I was there, they did have two little metal tables set up outside, which was nice... but they're super uncomfortable.

I love the pizza though.  I'm always going to need my fix.
author: Tamara N.

description:
Fast Sustenance. 
A slice literally thrown to me through a cab window. I texted my whereabouts to those concerned, and that I happened to be eating awesome pizza at the time. Only partially true, evidenced by my leaving half my "awesome" slice on a newspaper stand for whoever might want it, after exiting the cab. 
The [partial] slice was not awesome, but did the job.
author: Meg W.

description: Solid pie in a fun neighborhood. I got a mediterranean (artichoke hearts, feta, sun dried tomato) and a combo (green pepper, sausage, mushroom, pep, etc.). Both were great and only about 4 dollars each. A bit small on the inside but it's really designed to take-out.
author: Samir K.

description: Want to be pushed around and grab assed by a bunch of drunk frat guys at 2 am?  Want to wait in a 30 minute line that doesn't move, because I guess there's some rule that when one guy from a fraternity is in line ahead of you means each of his bros can jump in with him whenever they feel like it?  Bonus points for when it's cold and rainy, the slices are $4 (!!), they don't have what you want from the menu available, and nothing like what NY pizza tastes like.  It really is a pleasurable experience all around.
author: Monica R.

description:
Decent slices and toppings. Extremely fast service without a smile.

Extremely limited street parking in the neighborhood, but there is a parking lot up the street.
author: S M.

description:
Totally forgot about this place for awhile until I drove by here today. It made me want to write a review of the experiences I had coming here for lunch.

This place is quite small nd seats are limited but the neighborhood is delightful nd peaceful. I would usually grab a slice of pizza nd head towards Starbucks which is at the end of the block. There I would enjoy my slice nd a nice cold drink of whatever i wanted that day, either inside or outside of the store.
