It was fantastic...but all this hype good be that i was drunk...i dont know i'll keep 5 stars until i retry it....if it sucks or doesn't meet my expectation (meaning its better than pizza hut which is the worst god forsaken garbage in the world) it'll drop down to 1 star...hell i'll just delete my review if it comes down to it.
author: David M.

description: $3 for a piece of cheese pizza that I can roll up and eat away. I'm sold. The dough was a bit tough, maybe the piece I got was out for a bit too long, but it hit my craving.
author: Wendy B.

description: Wow. I ate here the first day I took a look at the apartment I ended up leasing. And I still love it. This place is great anytime of the day, drunk or sober. I've noticed that the crust is a little soft for my liking so I always ask to have my pizza "well-done", "extra crispy" or "almost burnt". There veggie pizza is awesome, the cheese pesto pizza is amazing, they make another pizza with sasuage/peperoni/bell peppers/onion, that is fabulous as well. Not too sure about the one with the potatoes on it, but so far I've been impressed everytime I've gone in there. Staff is friendly. and they take cards!
author: sierra s.

description: Perfect spot to grab a slice on the run. They are big and tasty! I recommend the veggie or one of the combos. The guys that work here are friendly and quick and the salads are big if you want a healthier option.
author: Kyla L.

description: Props for having interesting toppings, but I wasn't blown away.  I got a slice of potato and pesto for just under $4 bucks and it was pretty good.  Not sure if it needed whole cloves of garlic, might have been a little overboard.
author: Andrew R.

description: I love the pesto potato and garlic pizza here. They also have a great sausage pepperoni and bellpepper combo type that my fiance loves. It's a great little (barely any seating) pizza by the slice place, but if you are going to get 4 slices (they are huge), you may as well get a whole pie. It definitely hits the spot and my second fave pizza place in SF. (Pizza Orgasmica's still #1)
author: Samantha H.

description:
I'm a huge pizza lover and escape from new york is a great place to eat very late at night when you're going out on Polk Street.  The slices are large and the service is pretty good.  Since Polk Street has lots of nice places to eat during the day, escape from new york wouldn't really be my first choice, but during bar hours it's pretty much the only place I crave.  I love their everything pizza, and my friend is in love with the artichoke one.

They accidentally charged me twice the other night and when it showed up on my bank account I called just to let them know, not to get any credit back..it's not really worth the $3.  But the guy who talked to me was super nice and offered to give me a a free medium pizza!!  I like it.
author: Trisha H.

description:
good for that late night drunken pizza snack but if you are completely sober and looking for a good piece of pizza, stay away! MOST of the employees are super rude and the pizza sits out forever (like most places in the city) until you order it...then they just heat it up. So its a pretty disgusting concept altogether. Add that with the fact that, unless they know you, they are going to be incredibly bitchy towards you (the women mostly) and I would say you need at least 16 beers before you step foot in Escape from New York. Otherwise, it's totally not worth the wait, the harassment, and the stomachache the next day. 

In other news, the guys that work there are pretty awesome so on the dumbluck chance that you go when they are working, it could be worth it.
author: Sarah I.

description: I'm from CT and am probably more picky about my pizza than most New Yorkers.   This place gets 3 stars for the roasted garlic, pesto and potato combination.  The crust is a bit too thick for my liking but it is a decent piece of pizza even when I'm sober.
author: Julie P.

description:
twice.

twice i have called for a delivery only to have them never show up. When I call to ask they give me the "we tried to call you" bullshit. 

no good.
author: Jon G.

description: Similar to my feelings on wings at Kezar's I think that this is the best pizza option outside of NY. They're consistently good and not too overpriced.
author: Peter M.

description:
food: im from chicago and i never really loved pizza. this pizza i LOVE!!!!! 
space: standard clean. music is also really good most of the time. :)
staff: super awesome, they are  friendly to everyone who walks in. 
if you want something else other than pizza, you should try the chicken cesar salad!!! it is so loaded with chicken and cheese too! hmm ask for an extra dressing too!
author: Steve M.

description: Not quite as good as Za Pizza, but a whole hell of a lot cheaper, and very tasty.
author: Stu M.

description: Had a large combo pizza. The vegetables and meat were excellent, especially the tomatoes and sausage. The crust and cheese were lacking in my opinion; crust was a little bit under-done and the cheese was tasteless.
author: MTeresa W.

description: simple straightforward pizza....has kept me from EVER going into the other pizza place in the neighborhood
author: david f.

description: Enh.  Mediocre but never terrible.  Only if you're too lazy to walk up to Za, which is oodles and mountains better.
author: Ashley S.

description: 3 words: pesto potato pizza.  i can't get enough of it. there's always a line after 11p on weekends, but worth the wait.  Chefs are cool too.  much better than pizza orgasmica in my opinion.
author: Mike B.

description: Always great pizza after a night of drinking. Problem is they always seem to run out around 1-2 AM. It's good, but not as great if you simply order from there. The pizza's better by the slice. I agree with one of the other reviewers here: the best drunk pizza in the city might very well be Golden Boys.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: Having grown up in the northeast, I'm used to great ny style pizza.  escape from new york, is not great ny pizza.  If you're into the californian kinda pizzas, like your pesto chicken, then you'll like this place.  If you want an authentic ny pizza with pepperoni or sausage on it, grease dripping down when you fold it, and great tasting pizza, then fly back to the northeast, because I have yet to find it in cali.
author: Justin S.

description: I had a medium you say potato, it was my first time eating pizza with pesto sauce. I didn't like it too much. The pizza was a bit soggy and they overdid it with the sauce. I may come back here one day, but I sure won't order my pizza with pesto.
author: Josh E.

description: I'm from the Midwest, and am still looking for a really good pizza in this town!  I'm a veggie, so I enjoy that they have a good selection of veggie toppings.  The pizza is probably the best I've had in San Francisco so far, but I'm still looking for one better.  Also, they need to update their website - the prices are about $2 higher on a medium now...
author: Beth S.

description: Tiny Russian Hill location for this SF pizza chain.  Co-owned with the folks from Za (is there a Russian Hill Pizza Mafia or something??).  It's a good option when you're belly needs some pizza and you're in the neighborhood.  I'd recommend against the pesto slices until they learn to chill out on the oil!  The crust can be a bit tough (maybe over worked in the back) though I think a trip to the dentist for a chipped tooth is unlikely.  The salads are gigantic so consider getting a small.  It's a pizza joint so service tends to be utterly lacking.  The pizza is a bit thick for NY style, so taking some points away for that, but hey for CA it's a good go at NY Pizza!!
author: Daniel R.

description: I love this place, I eat there almost every day.  It's right down the street from my work.  I prefer the pepperoni but they make an awesome bbq chicken and bacon pizza, although they don't make it often.  You can order it specially though.  I highly recommend it.
author: Lisa H.

description: NOT WORTH IT.....an english muffin with ragu and melted cheese is 10x better!
author: Kaley T.

description: Great pizza by the slice choices. I get cravings for the pesto-potato.... Even my Italian friend likes this place.
author: Jaime R.

description: The pizza is alright, and I like the chicken Caesar salad, but I don't recommend this place. There's nothing special about any of the toppings and the cheese sucks. I guess some people like the special with the potato topping, but IMHO, potatoes and pizza don't mix. My main problem with this place is the staff is a bunch of punk ass losers (working at a pizza place...) that don't even look up when you walk in the door.
author: Adam R.

description:
this is one of my two favorite pizza places in the city.  i like the crust, and the you say potato is my favorite.  

dunno what all the whining is about:

jeff g. says that the soda "tastes like turd covered in burnt hair".  uhm, how do you know what turd and burnt hair tastes like to begin with?

cory g. complained about reheated slices.  unless you're ordering a whole pie, any place that serves slices is going to have to heat them up a bit (unless you got there just as they're taking a new pie out of the oven).

and adam r. says that "my main problem with this place is the staff is a bunch of punk ass losers (working at a pizza place...)".  perhaps you're so bitter because one of the staff dudes banged your girl?  she must have not been getting it from you; which dude was it?  seems as though you're the p.a.l., pal!

now shut up and eat!
author: Jay P.

description: i just cant help my garlic addiction, okay??? Stopped by for a quick slice of my fav. you say potato... potato, roasted garlic, on pesto sauce... usually YUMMY from the haight location... this one's crust was a second away from being  burnt, and was sooooo greasy... hmm... i think I will stick to the haight location
author: c e.

description: Two words. Pesto Chicken. Although even at their busiest hours, their pizzas still don't seem to move fast enough, and they're just lonely and sitting and awaiting eyeballs of the clientele, they'll toss your selected prize of pizza pie into the toaster, and they get it "almost" heated to where the cheese is oozing. Sometimes it feels like the pizza is a piece of cardboard with scrumptuous goodies piled high atop. I get spoiled with thick crust and cheese stuffed crusts, etc. I like a good doughy crust, which Escape doesn't necessarily have on any of their pizzas that are sitting and sliced and ready for slice purchases off the front window display/counter. I mean, the slices are $2-4 each, so it'd be cool to get something more substantial to pile "nummy" and "yummy" pesto and chicken and herbs atop of. At last, you can hop on the lunch special bandwagon. Hmmm- when I'm hungry and want a quick lunch under $10 in SF, this is a good spot. 3.5 stars. or 3.7.
author: Braden B.

description: Yea, everything is good when your drunk, The slices are made very thin and slightly burned and what's up with not being able to add toppings? The blonde cashier was extremely rude. The only good thing about this place is the location its in..or it would be out of business long time ago.
author: Peter T.

description: Opened recently in the space that used to be Nicky's Rustica Pizzeria or whatever.  Never went there, so I can't compare, but I can say that Escape From New York's pizza was delicious!  Ran in here to grab a quick bite before cramming into one of the many Polk Street bars to watch the Warriors game last night.  Due to the game, it wasn't very crowded and we could actually sit at the bar stools (there is only seating for maybe 10 people).  Huge slices, ranging in price from roughly $2.50 to 3.75 I think.  The best part was that it tastes like the pizza you get in New York, thin crust, piping hot, and not super greasy like another late-night pizza place that shall remain nameless (I think we all know what Marina favorite I'm talking about).  Let's just say I took their menu on my way out the door, because if their delivery pizza is as good as their by-the-slice, I think I just found my new pizza place!
author: Lindsay B.

description: This place re-affirms why getting slices is a waste.  Pizza that is cooked, then put under heat lamps for who knows how long, then put back in the oven....just does not taste good.  I have been there a number of times and it has not gotten any better.   Keep your expectations low...
author: Matt B.

description: its really good pizza for California but originally from NYC so its hard to give them more stars when you know you've had way better. but unless your flying across the country some escape from NY is about as good as it gets accept for a few gourmet places.
author: willie l.

description: best pepperponi pizza when you are intoxicated.. not too thick or too thin... just right and hit the spot when you have alcohol in you and didn't have dinner yet... their vegtarian one is good too... prices are reasonable... 3.25 a slice WHAT a DEAL!!
author: Lily T.

description: We finally found our "pizza place"! Everything here is delicious whether you order delivery or stumble past it drunkenly on Polk st
author: brad m.

description: This is probably the BEST pizza I have had in San Fran to date. This could largely be due to the fact that I always have this pizza when I'm drunk, between bar stops or on my way home from a night out on Polk. But does that really matter? Listen, it's good. Crust is chewy and delicious, they don't skimp out on ingredients, and it's affordable.
author: Jenna F.

description: 1st time through on Polk was great.  Haight locations kind of sucked.  Second time through on Polk, quality was about as good as the Haight locations.  I guess the consistency is off.   Having lived in NY, it seems that making authentic NY pizza would be somewhat easy.  Just use great dough, great sauce and don't use cheap cheese.  I think this place is cutting back on the quality of the ingredients so the overall pizza subsequently suffers.
author: Chris O.

description: I love pizza.  I adore it.  This place, eh, it's pretty good.  I would say it's my favorite place that delivers (although Za's is pretty good too).  Their pizza is better ordered by the slice at the place than delivery.  Although, if you get it delivered - stick it in the oven for a bit and it gets even better - nice cripsy crust!
author: Ming Y.

description: Definitely one of the better pies I've had in town (even if it isn't really "New York" style -- as others have noted, it's even better after hitting the bars.  "You Say Potato" rocks in particular.
author: Jay P.

description: Went here twice because I was in the area. They are located next to a club and went there after heavy drinking. I thought the slice I bought was he best slice I ever had, but I'm when you're drunk everything seems to taste good. I went there a second time hoping for the same experience. It wasn't as good as I remembered but it was still satisfying. They give you some of the bigger slices in town and free self serve water. The only thing that could be improved is the cleanliness of the store. I'd go back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Mack F.

description: i dont care, i like em' pesto pizza's the best! plus the guys there are chill and its just an old school pizza spot. its perfect
author: Jireh S.
